Posts.Content: On 2/23/2007 Ladyrumpers wrote: Hello all, I am new to all of this new Laptop, Did not know message boards existed. Any way I was diag., B.C. in2001 nearly 6yrs, gosh how time flys . Lumpectomy, lymph involvement,chemo(CMF) radio therapy followed by 2yrs Tamoxifen, 3yrs Arimadex,  go for annual check up July spoke to fellow patient she has been given Femara for a further 2yrs I was so looking forward to getting rid of my SWIMS   has anybody out there  suffered soakings, the least bit of exertion and the water runs down my face.Have tried all medication suggested now taking Megace, if anyone can comment I would be grateful. Talking of gateful nearly 6yrs on and so far O.K. Wishing I had, laptop years ago what a great help.hello ladyrumpers, i know all about heavy sweating, ugh!  i have had good reults with an antidepressant called effexor xr 37.5 mg 1x daily....you can take more if the low dose doesn't quite take care of this irritating situation....this is a rx....you must contact your dr... i didn't want to take this because i was not depressed......, mad, angry, anxious, sic of doctors but not depressed.. but i couldn't have a social life sweating like i was, couldn't sleep, hated to go out in public and have everyone stare at me when i was swimming in my own sweat....so i gave in, i would try anything to have a social life again.....and it works for me....when it gets really hot, i do have breakthrough flashes...i have used a natural product called belladonna  6x...4 tabs under the tongue and usually cuts the hot flashes or sweats for a few hours....i have learned to stay away from all caffine, concentrated sweets, hard candies, etc...everyone has something that can trigger the sweats.....drink plenty of water...also i have found heavy facial creams or sunblock triggers them instantly....hope this helps        carolgolf
Posts.Title: Sweats (SWIMS)

Posts.Content: hi bonbon1, i, too, have been researching this site and found many of the same complaints. I was started on armidex 3 months ago, my bones became glass with terrible pain, I have developed a rigid tendon in my hand making it difficult to hold anything. I had nausea,joint PAIN, tendon pain in my affected arm, swelling in both arms and leg, could hardly get around in my home. Now i have been switched to aromasin, the symptoms are returning starting with the hot prickly skin and swelling,,nausea, and joint discomfort. I am at the point of saying no more drugs, i want to function and be my active self . i have had 37 rad trts. My dr. states he will put me on tamoxifin if this one effects me. I feel like a guinea pig for cancer. I was on HRT prior to all of this, due to a hysterectomy. I wish I had more answers.
Posts.Title: Can Frmara Make You Ache?

Posts.Content: Hi Australia, I currently am having lymph massage done with relief to my affected arm. I still have difficulty laying on my stomach due to the radiation to my breast. Thank you for your reply and suggestion. carolgolf
Posts.Title: Can Frmara Make You Ache?

Posts.Content: HELLO BOBBIE F. GOOD FOR YOU!!!! So great to hear someone had a doctor that actually listened and respected his clients wishes... I sincerely hope all goes well for you from now on..Did you have the TRAM procedure done? Thanks for sharing your story carolgolf
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: Hello, this year I had a lumpectomy with 37 Radiation trts. Now let me start at the beginning. I was diagnosed, had lumpectomy, had a lymph dissection of 6, 2 tiny lymphs positive, had 14 more removed. no further detection. The trt for me was decided, radiation and oral estrogen blocker. All along this process I did not want radiation, I wanted my breast removed. I was told there is no statics showing a better outcome one way or the other. To this day, I would still have my breast removed than take radiation..too late for me now. If you do have the radiation, be sure to check around for the newest equipment and who is monitoring your trts. When a person is hit with the word cancer, we often surrender to the physican for the best trt for us. Think it through, go for the second opinion. carolgolf
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy With Raditaion? Yes or No?

Posts.Content: This is how I started, had the biopsy, no cancer, followed with 6 mo mammograms, a year later CANCER. GET IT OUT NOW...Demand removal....Good luck carolgolf
Posts.Title: 3rd Opinion?

Posts.Content: Gearl H. Is she on any preventive meds, such as estrogen blockers? I realize you didn't say if the cancer was estrogen positive. Radiation is fatiging within itself. Many factors to consider with her symptoms. Is she eating good foods, diabetic?, other meds interacting, depression, etc. You always can get the second opinion, take results of all previous test. Just curious, was she on HRT prior to brst. ca.? Has she had a hysterectomy? How old is she? Check out the second opinion....stay in touch carolgolf
Posts.Title: Radiation Side Effects

Posts.Content: Geez, 3 weeks seems to me like a long time to wait for monitor results...Again, there are so many factors to take into consideration. May I be personal and ask what stage was your daughter's cancer? No lymph involvement? No preventive oral treatments since surgery? Of what area was the MRI done. She did not have any of this prior to breast cancer diagonsis? Was she on hormonal replacement therapy prior to her diagonsis? If so may I ask for how long? And is her cancer positive for estrogen, progestrone? I really would be camping on the phone to get the monitor results and get into see the neurologist. Please stay in touch. A prayer will be said for your daughter and family. carolgolf
Posts.Title: Radiation Side Effects

Posts.Content: joanm, good to hear from you. I did a little research on myomin and was a bit confused with what i read. Stated myomin acts as an inhibitor of aromisin, this does not sound like a treatment of choice. Myomin is suppose to balance out estrogen to decrease cystic fibroids. I did not find anything stating to assist in treatment of breast cancer. Did not state a blocker of estrogen or blocker in breast tissue. Did mention decrease in the bad estrogen, in turn elevating good estrogen. Did i not read the correct info or not enough?? My I ask what you were told the action is of myomin?? thanks carolgolf
Posts.Title: Aromasin or Myomin

Posts.Content: joanne, I too, would like more info on this natural treatment. Where do you find this product I have been on both inhibitors and now on tamoxifen. My life is on hold, in a chair and basically crippling effect when taking them. would appreciate a natural alternative thanks, carolgolf
Posts.Title: Aromasin or Myomin

Posts.Content: Joanm, Have you started myomin yet? If so, are weaning yourself off the inhibitors while taking myomin? I am interested in how you feel? thanks carolgolf
Posts.Title: Aromasin or Myomin

Posts.Content: Molly, sorry for the mix up with your name however when I clicked reply to message, your name comes up Mary. Man, I don't need more confusion in my life, haha. The lack of estrogen doesn't allow me to be sharpest tack in the box anymore.......carolg.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Good morning Molly, Well yesterday had my first mammogram since all this started. However, couldn't get the results due to the place where I had radiation, sent my films to the wrong hospital. And I wonder if anyone knows what they are doing,haha. So I have to call them in 2 weeks. I was told the burning will last for quite awhile in my breast plus the tissue is retaining fluid from lymph removal. At least there is no edema in my arm, I find exercising twice daily with 3 lb. weights helps alot on keeping the swelling away. I hope all goes well for you, we are leaving for several weeks, however I am taking my laptop. Will try to stay in connect. I have scheduled an appt. with a naturalist, in Ohio, will be of interest to hear her take on all of this. My body still feels like a toxic waste dump. Yesterday in the clinic, I talked to a lady who's husband is an oceanographer, she said they will not eat anything that comes from the bottom such as shrimp,lobster, oysters,etc. What does that say about our enviorment?? Hope all gets better for you and all. Next we write, maybe we will have great news to share, that is my prayer. Will check this site peroidically, so post your news. carolgolf PS. WHY IS YOUR SCREEN NAME SO MIXED UP?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Good Morning, Glad I could share something to help someone. Check your phone book and find a person certified to do lymph massage. Do you have a compression sleeve and/or glove? I use mine everyday when my activity slows or in a car for long distance. Also have a squeeze ball I use when resting, this helps move the fluid via muscle use. We are planning to head out again from here the end of the month, going into Canada and upper New York, Boston then back to bug the kids again. Expecting to return to Florida in Sept. Hopefully next week I will get the results to my mammogram, Can't help but worry about it. Have you had/heard of a blood test called CA-125? Just read about it, suppose to be the same as a PSA for men. Hope this finds you feeling better. So nice to have women to consult with and share with. We are leaving here for a few days may not be able to hookup but will return when I can. May you have a Blessing today... carolg.

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi, Made it to Ohio, had a lovely trip, stayed off ther interstate. I know the pain you are having, I also have it. I find motrin and placing a heating pad over my breast helps, also massage the breast tissue towards the lymph glands, in my case it starts with fluid retention. A trick I have learned, buy cheap colgate shaving cream and massage your arm, underarm, shoulder, and breast tissue with every shower. Has anyone showed you the technique? It is an art, you can pull it up on the internet if not. Wear a supportive but not tight bra or sports bra, remove when possible. As we speak my heating pad is warming up, been travelling all day and my breast is really warm and tender. If you notice any reddness on the tissue, call your doctor right away... How many lymph did you have removed? I had a total of 20. I exercise everyday with 3 and 5 lb. weights to keep the fluid moving out of my arm. Let know if any of this works for you. carolgolf
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Mary, sorry for the delay in a reply. didn't get a pop-up telling of your note. I am going next Tues to see my onocologist, will be discussing this drug. Yes, I have heavy harsh hot flashes causing sweat running down my neck and face, heart palpations, weepy, fatigue, especially muscle fatigue, last monday I couldn't play 18 holes of golf using a cart, the club fell out of my hand twice. Thank goodness for friends, so supportive but devastating to me.I have noticed increase thrist and have gained four pounds in 3 days, nausea is constant and getting worse. I have never taken anything other than allergy pills, HRT and vitamins. Couldn't take birth control when I was young, had my tubes liagated when 27. If I get any answers I will post them. I WANT MY LIFE BACK. I am exploring going the natural route. One thing to watch is your cholestrol, Mine shot up with the estrogen blockers. Of course the Dr. wanted to add another pill, I said no. I changed my diet, started taking a rice bran protein drink every morning and had a recheck after 90 days, I lowered it 50 points and have lost 19 lbs until a few days ago. I had water retention with the other 2 estrogen blockers. So I will let you know what goes tues. carolgolf
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hey Anne W.,, Well the onocologist took me off the tamoxifen, said I am not a canidate for estrogen blockers, orally. Said chemo would cause more harm than good. Asked about a natural blocker, said the side effects would probably be the same. There is one I have purchased, Indole-3-Carbinol. I read a reasearch paper on it showing 90% effectiveness vs. 60% tamoxifen, published in 1999. I really don't know what to do. I still wish I would have had my breast removed and no radiation therapy... Going for the mammogram tomorrow. My breast burns all the time as well as being hot to touch, since the radiation. Does anyone know the truth in treatment of breast cancer or Is it just a educated staticial treatment.... Stay in Touch. Can't give my email through this site. Don't know how to get it to you. How long have you been off the tamoxifen? Carolgolf

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi Molly2, I too am on this drug and I can tell you, so far, this is nothing compared to armidex or aromasin.. Those two are so evil in side effects for me. I considered taking nothing also. My onocologist suggested I try the ole standby. Like I said this is good so far. The hot flashes are miserable, some fatigue. but I am able to function socially which I couldn't with the other two. I was on HRT for ten years before being diagnosed last Nov. How I yearn for the good days of a patch,haha. But it can never be again. I also had 20 lymph nodes removed and 37 radiation treatments. But, I am serious, not every med is agreeable with every person. So do consult your doctor... Let us know how it turns out for you. carolgolf

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen

Posts.Content: hi, i too, am an RN, with brst Ca. I hope your biopsy was neg. now i will share a little of my story. i too had the neg. core biopsy in 2004. f/u with every 6mo. mammograms. how i wish i could go back to that day of finding the lump. Please if it is neg. INSIST on having it removed. i don't care what kind of f/u offered or what your insurance says it will pay, HAVE IT REMOVED. if you are willing to let me know i would appreciate an update on you.
Posts.Title: What is Normal?

Posts.Content: i too, had that prickling sensation of my skin, but the swelling and joint pain on armidex was the my main concern. now on aromasin and it is all starting again, even the hot prickling skin sensation. it is like a fore runner for the swelling that occurs. notify your onocologist.
Posts.Title: Side Effects

Posts.Content: I can only share my experience. I was on armidex,then aromisin,and finally tamoxifen. Couldn't tolerate any of them, too many harsh painful and life limiting side effects. Now I feel good and am active, will always have limitations with my left arm,I did have 37 radiation treatments. I went today for a second opinion, first he didnot want to believe the side effects I had then he wants me to have chemo. I have had my checkup with success, no cancer showed. so why would I want to do chemo almost a year after surgery. If he can show me I have a cancer cell then I would consider..Treatment is a personal choice..Like taking all those meds last winter, I felt I went thru hell with the side effects,then the doctors say I can't tolerate them and said they only gave me a 5% less chance of cancer return. I went thru hell for 5%...Now this Dr. Named off some other oral blockers and wanted to know if they were offered to me, I asked what the side effects were and he named off the ones I had already experienced.haha I just laughed at him..I told him I feel like a $*%!* guinea pig in all of this...So it is up to you to decide upon your treatment. I want quality life, over my husband helping me from chair to bed to car to doctors...let me know what you decide....carol g.
Posts.Title: What Would Happen If...
